summary: This is a formal discovery and Brady material request letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys (Cohen & Gresser LLP) to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. The letter outlines 22 specific requests for evidence, witness information, and communications related to the government's case against Maxwell, including details about the 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement with Jeffrey Epstein and information about minor victims and their attorneys.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The client of the law firm Cohen & Gresser LLP, who is the subject of the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter is a discovery request on her behalf.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Repeatedly referenced as the central figure in the alleged abuse conspiracy. The letter requests information about the Non-Prosecution Agreement he signed in 2007 and communications with his attorneys.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP who signed the discovery request letter on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Bradley Edwards
persons.context: Listed among the "Attorneys" representing victims in the case. The letter requests communications between these attorneys and prosecutors.

connections.description: Maxwell is charged in connection with Epstein's alleged sex trafficking operation. The document references her alleged involvement in facilitating abuse.
Everdell is a defense attorney at Cohen & Gresser LLP writing this discovery request on behalf of client Ghislaine Maxwell.
Edwards is listed as an attorney for victims, and the defense requests communications between him and prosecutors concerning Maxwell.
Edwards is listed as an attorney for Epstein's victims. The defense requests communications between Epstein's attorneys and the government regarding the NPA.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein Signs Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein signed a Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA) with federal prosecutors. The defense requests all communications concerning the negotiations of this agreement.

events.title: Attorneys Meet with SDNY Prosecutors
events.description: Attorneys for victims (including Bradley Edwards) met with SDNY prosecutors to request a criminal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. SDNY declined to pursue the case at that time.

events.title: SDNY Investigation Begins
events.description: The government asserts that the SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell began in or about 2018.

events.title: Defense Files Discovery Requests
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys formally submit extensive discovery and Brady material requests to the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: The defense is seeking all communications related to the negotiation of Jeffrey Epstein's 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement (NPA), including unredacted emails between the government and Epstein's attorneys.
The defense requests the identities and complete birthdates of the individuals identified in the indictment as Minor Victims 1-3.
The letter reveals that victim attorneys, including Bradley Edwards, met with SDNY prosecutors in 2016 to push for a criminal investigation into Epstein and Maxwell, but SDNY declined at that time.
The defense is seeking a wide range of potentially exculpatory and impeachment material, including evidence about witness credibility, financial motives, and prior inconsistent statements.
The document references an FBI investigation into an unnamed individual for obstruction of justice, mentioned in a government production cover letter from August 21, 2020.
